meanings.definition: To adapt (a story, event, etc.) into a dramatic form.
meanings.sent1: She dramatized the book by turning it into a play.
meanings.sent2: The movie dramatized the historical event with intense scenes.
meanings.sent3: The children dramatized their favorite story for the school play.
meanings.sent4: His retelling of the incident was so dramatized, it felt like a live performance.
meanings.sent5: The theater group dramatized the classic tale with elaborate costumes and sets.

meanings.definition: To make (something) more exciting or interesting.
meanings.sent1: The magician dramatized his tricks to captivate the audience.
meanings.sent2: The artist dramatized the painting by adding vibrant colors.
meanings.sent3: The chef dramatized the dessert presentation with a sparkler on top.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was so dramatized that everyone was on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent5: The explorer's journal entries were dramatized to engage readers in his adventures.
